Section Header:
Sex and Gender Identity

The next questions are about sex and gender identity. In order for our research to be compared with other studies we have used standard measures similar to the National Census. This information is used to monitor equality between groups of people of different genders and sexes. Equality monitoring helps make sure that everyone is treated fairly and helps identify what services are needed.

You can choose not to answer any of the questions. If you feel that there is not an answer that applies to you, there will be a space for you to enter your own response.
Field Label:
What is your sex?
(The biological sex on your birth certificate)

A question about gender identity will follow in the survey
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Female | 2, Male | 3, Do not wish to answer | 4, Wish to enter own response

Field Label: Space to self describe

What is your gender?
(How you would describe yourself)
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Female | 2, Male | 3, Non-binary | 4, Wish to enter own response | 5, Do not wish to answer

Field Label: Space to self describe

Disability

In this section of the survey, you will be asked questions about any disabilities you may have. Remember, if you do not want to answer a question, you can skip it.
Do you have any physical or mental health conditions or illnesses?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 2, No

Field Label: Has this lasted, or is it expected to last, for 12 months or more?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 2, No

Field Label: Do any of your illnesses or conditions reduce your ability to carry out day to day activities?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes a lot | 2, Yes a little | 3, Not at all

Field Label:
Material Possessions 

In this part of the survey you will be asked questions about the things you have.  Remember, if you do not want to answer a question, you can skip it.

Which of these things do you have:
Your own mobile phone
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No

Field Label: A computer, laptop or tablet with internet at home
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No

Field Label: At least one family holiday away from home in a typical year
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No

Field Label: A family car, van, or truck
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No

Field Label: A bedroom for yourself
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No

Field Label: Compared to your friends, would you say your family is richer, about the same, poorer or don't know?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Richer | 2, About the same | 3, Poorer | 4, Don't know

Field Label: How often do you worry about how much money your family has?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Never | 2, Some of the time | 3, All of the time

Field Label: When you are at home on a typical day in winter, are you (and everyone in your household) warm enough?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes - always | 2, Yes - sometimes | 3, No - rarely | 4, No - never

Field Label: My parents/guardians have talked about the need to cut back on certain things to save money.
Which of the following have your parents/guardians discussed cutting back on? (tick all that apply)
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Using too much energy (e.g. gas or electric) | 2, Luxuries (e.g. takeaways, eating out, new cars, new clothes etc.) | 3, Holidays and leisure activities (e.g. hobbies outside of school, trips etc.) | 4, Food shopping | 5, Car journeys to save fuel

Section Header:
Household Structure

In this part of the survey you will be asked questions about who you live with.

All of your responses are completely confidential.

Remember, if you do not want to answer a question, you can skip it.
Field Label: Where do you live most of the time?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, I live with my parent(s)/carer(s) | 2, I live at both of my parents' houses, some of the time at each | 3, I live with other family members | 4, I live somewhere else

Field Label:
Who else lives in your home?

If you live at both your parents' houses, some of the time at each, just think about the house where you spend most of your time
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Mother | 2, Father | 3, Guardian | 4, Foster carer | 5, Step mother | 6, Step father | 7, Mother's partner | 8, Father's partner | 9, Siblings | 10, Auntie | 11, Uncle | 12, Grandmother | 13, Grandfather | 14, Cousins | 15, Other

Field Label: How often does your family get along together?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Never | 2, Some of the time | 3, Always

Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Never | 2, Some of the time | 3, Always | 4, I don't live with any siblings

Your Financial Resources

Field Label: Given money by parents when I need it

Section Header:
Food Availability

In this part of the survey you will be asked questions about the availability of food to you.

Your answers will help local organisations support people's access to food in your community and across Bradford.

Remember, all of your responses are completely confidential. If you do not want to answer a question, you can skip it.
Field Label: We can't get the food we want because there is not enough money
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No

Field Label: I worry about not having enough to eat
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No

Field Label: I worry about how hard it is for my parents to get enough food for us
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No

Field Label: I feel hungry because there is not enough food to eat
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No

Field Label: I try not to eat a lot so that our food will last
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No

Field Label:
Social Comparison

In this part of the survey you will be asked questions about how you feel about comparisons people make between each other..

Remember, all of your responses are completely confidential. If you do not want to answer a question, you can skip it.
How often do you think that people compare you to others to see if you match up
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Never | 2, Rarely | 3, Sometimes | 4, Mostly | 5, Always

Neighbourhood

This part of the survey will ask you questions about your neighbourhood. Remember, if you do not want to answer a question, you can skip it.

How do you rate the following in the area that you live?
Your safety when going out after dark

Field Label:
Activities

In this section we'll be asking all about your involvement in arts and culture activities.

Your answers will help local organisations identify which arts and culture activities are most relevant to young people, and how organisations can support young people to engage in these activities. 

 

Did you do any of the following activities in the last month?
Sing, play an instrument, or make music (either on your own or as part of a choir/band/orchestra)

Field Label:
Eating Habits

The next questions will ask you about food and whether you are happy with your size or the way you look.  Some people can get quite worried about these things, but may find it difficult to speak about them, whereas others will not worry about them at all. 

It is incredibly valuable to us if you can answer these questions even if this is something that does not give you any concern. It will help us understand what type of support is needed for teenagers, and help local services and organisations to improve things for young people.

Please remember, all of your responses are completely confidential and if you really do not want to answer a question, you can skip it. If anything upsets you, please talk to your teacher or access the information provided at the end of the survey.

 

On how many of the past 7 days...
Have you been deliberately trying to limit the amount of food you eat to influence your weight or shape (whether or not you have succeeded)?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, 0 days | 2, 1-2 days | 3, 3-5 days | 4, 6-7 days

Field Label: Have you gone for long periods of time (e.g., 8 or more waking hours) without eating anything at all in order to influence your weight or shape?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, 0 days | 2, 1-2 days | 3, 3-5 days | 4, 6-7 days

Field Label: Has thinking about food, eating or calories made it very difficult to concentrate on things you are interested in (such as working, following a conversation or reading)?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, 0 days | 2, 1-2 days | 3, 3-5 days | 4, 6-7 days

Field Label: Has thinking about your weight or shape made it very difficult to concentrate on things you are interested in (such as working, following a conversation or reading)?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, 0 days | 2, 1-2 days | 3, 3-5 days | 4, 6-7 days

Field Label: Have you had a definite fear that you might gain weight?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, 0 days | 2, 1-2 days | 3, 3-5 days | 4, 6-7 days

Field Label: Have you had a strong desire to lose weight?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, 0 days | 2, 1-2 days | 3, 3-5 days | 4, 6-7 days

Field Label: Have you tried to control your weight or shape by making yourself sick (vomit) or taking laxatives?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, 0 days | 2, 1-2 days | 3, 3-5 days | 4, 6-7 days

Field Label: Have you exercised in a driven or compulsive way to control your weight, shape or body fat, or to burn off calories?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, 0 days | 2, 1-2 days | 3, 3-5 days | 4, 6-7 days

Field Label: Have you felt like you had lost control over your eating (at the time that you were eating)?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, 0 days | 2, 1-2 days | 3, 3-5 days | 4, 6-7 days

Field Label: On how many of these days ( i.e. days on which you had a sense of having lost control over your eating) did you eat what other people would regard as an unusually large amount of food in one go?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, 0 days | 2, 1-2 days | 3, 3-5 days | 4, 6-7 days

Field Label:
Over the past 7 days....

Has your weight or shape influenced how you think about (judge) yourself as a person?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Not at all | 2, Slightly | 3, Moderately | 4, Markedly

Field Label:
Over the past 7 days....

How dissatisfied have you been with your weight or shape?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Not at all | 2, Slightly | 3, Moderately | 4, Markedly

Field Label:
Puberty

In this part of the survey you will be asked questions about your experience of going through puberty and some of the changes your body may go through. Remember, all of your responses are completely confidential, and if you do not want to answer a question, you can skip it.

Puberty can involve lots of changes to your body such as a growth spurt, new body hair, changes to your body, skin or voice. These changes happen for different people at different ages.

Has your body started changing?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, I have not started puberty | 2, I have only just started puberty | 3, I have definitely started puberty | 4, I have completed puberty

Field Label: Have you started your periods?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 2, No

Field Label:
How old were you when you had your first period?

Section Header:
Gambling

The next few questions are about gambling activities you might have taken part in. Gambling includes gaming, betting and lotteries. Remember, everything you tell us is confidential; no one at school will see your answers and if you do not want to answer a question, you can skip it.
Field Label:
Have you ever spent money on any of the following activities?

Please tick all that apply

Section Header:

Field Label: What prevented you?

Sedentary Activity

These questions are about sedentary activity out of school. Sedentary activity means activity sitting or lying down, including things like watching TV, playing video games, and using a mobile phone. 

Please select how long you usually spend doing the following activities:

Watching TV outside of school time

This includes time spent watching TV programmes, movies or sports but NOT time spent playing video games
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Did not do | 2, Less than 1 hour per day | 3, 1 to 2 hours per day | 4, 2 to 3 hours per day | 5, 3 hours per day or more

Field Label:
Playing video games outside of school time

This includes games on things like Nintendo DS, wii, Xbox, PlayStation, iPod Touch, iPad, or games on your PC and phone
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Did not do | 2, Less than 1 hour per day | 3, 1 to 2 hours per day | 4, 2 to 3 hours per day | 5, 3 hours per day or more

Field Label:
Using Computers or tablets outside of school time

This doesn't include homework time and playing online video games or computer games, but does include time on things like Instagram and Facebook, as well as time spent on the internet, and messaging like whatsapp
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Did not do | 2, Less than 1 hour per day | 3, 1 to 2 hours per day | 4, 2 to 3 hours per day | 5, 3 hours per day or more

Field Label:
Using a mobile phone after school

This includes time spent talking, texting, or using things like social media but does not include playing games
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Did not do | 2, Less than 1 hour per day | 3, 1 to 2 hours per day | 4, 2 to 3 hours per day | 5, 3 hours per day or more

Field Label:
